name: CHARLOTTE CURTIS, A COLUMNIST FOR THE TIMES, IS DEAD AT 58
sentences: Charlotte Curtis, a columnist for The New York Times and former editor of the newspaper's family/style news and later of its Op-Ed page, died of cancer yesterday at Ohio State University Hospital in Columbus, Ohio.

In a 25-year career with The Times, Miss Curtis, as a reporter and as an editor, helped transform the coverage of fashion and society news, supervised the daily page of opinion opposite the editorial page and for the last four years wrote a weekly column of social commentary.
''As a person and as a superb journalist, she will be missed and mourned.

But it was as a society news reporter in the 1960's, chronicling the life styles of the rich and powerful, that Miss Curtis became one of the nation's best-known journalists and set a pattern followed by other writers.

'' The reversal of Mr. Boyd's fortunes came in June 2003, when he and Howell Raines, the paper's executive editor, resigned after revelations of fabrications and plagiarism by a young reporter, Jayson Blair, ignited a firestorm of newsroom criticism against their management.
He met Robin Stone, a journalist, during a recruiting trip after he joined The Times's management.
The following year, the National Association of Black Journalists honored him as its journalist of the year.
'' He then concluded: ''Many of you know I've spent my life trying to be a good journalist.
He was not in fact the youngest journalist chosen for the fellowship.

name: Jess Blancornelas, 70; Reported on Mexico's Drug Violence
sentences: Jess Blancornelas, a fearless journalist who won several awards for his crusade against drug cartels and survived an assassination attempt in 1997, died Thursday in Tijuana, where he founded Zeta magazine.

name: Willie Pep, 84, Dies; Champion Who Made Others Miss
sentences: Red Smith, the sports columnist of The Times, told of the day in 1956 when he saw Pep ''boxing one Kid Campeche in a Tampa armory, probably a $300 fight for the old champion.

name: Robert Kupperman, Expert On Terrorism, Is Dead at 71
sentences: ''Terrorists are undergoing a dangerous metamorphosis -- from technological clods relying on fanaticism to skilled tacticians,'' he warned in a 1988 Op-Ed article in The New York Times, written with a journalist, Jeff Kamen.

name: Dave Cockrum, Comic Book Artist, Dies at 63
sentences: Comics Reporter noted the handsomeness of both men and women, as well as an overall ''sumptuous, late-'70s cinema style.

name: Smith Hempstone, 77, Journalist Who Became a Prominent Ambassador, Is Dead
sentences: Smith Hempstone, a journalist who became United States ambassador to Kenya and pushed so forcefully for democracy in that country that its one-party government denounced him as a racist and demanded his recall, died on Nov. 19 in Bethesda, Md.

Mr. Hempstone's circuitous route to ambassador included working as a correspondent in Kenya in its war for independence; as a novelist; as editor of The Washington Star editorial page; as a syndicated columnist; and as executive editor and editor in chief of The Washington Times.

name: Mario Llerena, 93, Dies; Castro Ally, Then Critic
sentences: He worked in Cuba as a political journalist, writing critically of Mr. Castro's drift toward Communism, and flew into exile in New York in April 1960.

name: Herman Klurfeld, 90, Wrote Winchell Columns and Quips
sentences: Herman Klurfeld, a ghostwriter for the legendary columnist Walter Winchell for almost three decades, died last Monday in Boca Raton, Fla., where he had lived for many years.
Mr. Winchell, at The Daily Mirror, discovered him after Leonard Lyons, a New York Post columnist, published one of his gags.
'' HBO made the film ''Winchell'' in 1998 starring Stanley Tucci as the columnist and Paul Giamatti as Mr. Klurfeld.

Correction:  December 28, 2006, Thursday  An obituary on Monday about Herman Klurfeld, a ghostwriter for the gossip columnist Walter Winchell, referred incorrectly in some copies to the year that the movie ''Winchell'' was released.

name: Frank Stanton, Who Guided CBS Into the Television Era, Dies at 98
sentences: But one person he could not control was Edward R. Murrow, CBS's most celebrated journalist.

name: Frank Tremaine, 92, Reporter Who Broke Pearl Harbor News
sentences: Frank Tremaine, a retired senior vice president at United Press International who as a young reporter filed what is believed to have been the first eyewitness account of the bombing of Pearl Harbor, died in Savannah, Ga., on Dec. 7, the 65th anniversary of the attack.

name: President Gerald R. Ford, Who Led U.S. Out of Watergate Era, Dies at 93
sentences: Bud Vestal, a reporter for The Grand Rapids Press, distressed Mr. Ford by noting in a biography that Mr. Ford ''never authored a major program of legislation on his own.

name: Saddam Hussein, Defiant Dictator Who Ruled Iraq With Violence and Fear
sentences: He once reacted with wonder when an American reporter told him that the United States had no law against insulting the president.
